description: Democrats were whispering names of those who could run instead of Biden, while speculating on the feasibility of a ticket swap before their party’s convention.
title: Panicked Emails, Gallows Humor: The Aftermath of Biden's Debate Disaster

description: Democrats have ways to replace Joe Biden at the top of their presidential ticket after a harrowing debate against Republican Donald Trump — but doing so without their standard-bearer’s acquiescence would be a daunting task.
title: Here’s What It Would Take to Replace Biden as Nominee

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Allies Try to Calm Fears After Disastrous Debate With Trump

description: The US Supreme Court’s Friday decision limiting how prosecutors can use an Enron-era obstruction law could give Donald Trump new fuel to fight charges that he tried to overturn the 2020 election results.
title: Trump Gets Boost From Supreme Court Ahead of Immunity Ruling

description: The heads of South Africa’s two main political parties are nearing an agreement over how positions in the executive will be shared, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa, DA Leader Near Deal on Cabinet Posts

description: On this episode of Voternomics, we discuss the fallout from a matchup marked by a poor presidential showing and Donald Trump’s repeated falsehoods.
title: Democrats Face the Aftermath of Biden’s Debate Performance

description: An FBI accountant who detailed the cash and gold bars seized at Senator Bob Menendez’s house was the final prosecution witness at the corruption trial of the New Jersey Democrat.
title: FBI Witness Adds Up the Cash, Gold Bars at Bob Menendez’s House

description: The Pentagon dismantled a temporary pier that brought aid to the Gaza Strip and has no immediate plans to return it, dealing another blow to a program that’s become a symbol of the US struggle to ease the enclave’s dire humanitarian crisis.
title: US Dismantles Gaza Pier With No Prospect of Bringing It Back

description: Steve Bannon, a longtime adviser to President Donald Trump, lost his fight to stay out of jail while he challenges his conviction for contempt of Congress.
title: Trump Aide Bannon Faces Prison After Supreme Court Rejection

description: The US Supreme Court overturned a 40-year-old legal doctrine that Democratic administrations have used to set regulations, a reversal of precedent that took power away from executive branch agencies that enforce environmental, consumer and financial rules. The so-called Chevron doctrine, or Chevron deference, spawned by a 1984 Supreme Court ruling, was a longtime target of conservatives unhappy with the rule-making power of executive branch agencies. Here’s some background on the Chevron doctrin
title: How Supreme Court’s Reversal of ‘Chevron’ Ruling Took Power From US Regulators

description: Thursday night’s debate between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump drew an audience of 47.9 million viewers, CNN reported, citing preliminary figures.
title: Biden-Trump Debate Draws Fewer Viewers Than 2020 Contest

description: President Joe Biden said he is committed to winning the November election, brushing aside mounting calls from prominent Democrats to step aside following his disastrous debate against Republican Donald Trump.
title: Biden Says He’ll Remain in 2024 Race, Rebuffing Calls to Quit

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally has cemented its lead ahead of the first round of France’s snap legislative election on Sunday, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Bloomberg French Poll of Polls: Le Pen’s Group Bolsters Lead

description: Justice Neil Gorsuch achieved his decades-long goal of burying a legal principle that has empowered regulatory agencies at the expense of judges.
title: Blockbuster Supreme Court Ruling Caps Gorsuch’s Long Quest to Gut Agency Power

description: Individuals and organizations gave £8.6 million ($10.9 million) to the opposition Labour Party in the first half of the UK election campaign, accounting for around 70% of all donations made to political parties ahead of next week’s vote.
title: Labour Donations Eclipse Tories Mid-Way Through UK Vote Campaign

description: Peru’s struggling state-owned oil company is asking the government to convert some of its loans into equity and push back deadlines to avoid running out of cash this year.
title: Petroperu Seeks New Loan Relief From Government as Cash Dries Up

description: Iran’s snap presidential election got underway on Friday with the country’s stagnant economy and opposition to the ruling theocratic system weighing heavily on voters.
title: Iran’s Election Underway With Discontent Seen Affecting Turnout

description: The Supreme Court’s last opinion day will be Monday, July 1, said Chief Justice John Roberts on Friday, teeing up a dramatic finale to an unusually long Supreme Court term.
title: Supreme Court’s Last Opinion Day Will Be Monday, Roberts Says

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan echoed Syrian counterpart Bashar Al-Assad in expressing a willingness to restore diplomatic relations, a policy shift backed by Russia that could help end the long-running war in Syria.
title: Turkey’s Erdogan, Syria’s Assad Signal Readiness to Restore Ties

description: Leave it to the Poles to articulate in public what many in Europe are too fearful to say out loud: Joe Biden should have known when to quit.
title: ‘I Was Afraid of This’: Biden Debate Debacle Rocks US Allies

description: The US Supreme Court sided with a Jan. 6 Capitol riot defendant in a ruling that could affect hundreds of prosecutions, including the criminal case in Washington against former President Donald Trump.
title: Supreme Court Backs Jan. 6 Defendant, Curbing Enron Law Use

description: A divided US Supreme Court threw out a decades-old legal doctrine that empowered federal regulators to interpret unclear laws, issuing a blockbuster ruling that will constrain environmental, consumer and financial-watchdog agencies.
title: Supreme Court Overturns Chevron Rule in Blow to Agency Power

description: Argentine President Javier Milei said Friday that his government will change its monetary policy framework following his first major legislative victory that secured his landmark economic reforms.
title: Milei Says Legislative Win Paves Way for Monetary Policy Pivot

description: Tata Steel Ltd. has raised the ante in its tussle with UK’s labor union over its decision to close blast furnaces in the Welsh town of Port Talbot by threatening legal action.
title: Tata Steel Seeks Legal Action in Tussle With Union Over UK Plant

description: China appointed veteran official Han Jun as the Communist Party chief at the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, according to a government statement.
title: China Names Han Jun as New Party Chief of Agriculture Ministry

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business, and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: A Clash of Visions Dominates Iran’s Presidential Election

description: The South African rand rallied on optimism that efforts to create a broad coalition government were on track, making it one of few emerging currencies to post gains over a first half characterized by increased geopolitical risks.
title: Rand Leads Emerging-Market Gains on Encouraging Political News

description: President Emmanuel Macron’s approval rating fell to the lowest level in three months, delivering a boost to Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally party just two days before voting starts in France’s legislative election.
title: Macron’s Approval Drops Two Days Ahead of French Election

description: Russia is planning to ratchet up eightfold a fee on divorces as Moscow seeks more revenue to fund President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, while also discouraging people from ending marriage.
title: Russia Plans to Jack Up Divorce Fees Amid Hunt for War Funding

description: The British Business Bank has warned officials it could cost as much as £1 million ($1.3 million) to hire a manager for its flagship investment fund unveiled last autumn, setting the scene for a potential clash with a likely Labour government after the July 4 election.
title: UK State Bank Warns of £1 Million Bill to Hire a Top Executive

description: Microsoft Corp.’s $13 billion investment into OpenAI Inc. is set to come under added scrutiny from European Union’s antitrust watchdogs, who are poised to quiz rivals about the AI firm’s exclusive use of Microsoft’s cloud technology.
title: Microsoft’s $13 Billion OpenAI Pact Faces Extra EU Scrutiny

description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK party rose to a fresh record in Bloomberg’s UK poll of polls, as their support level closed in on that of the governing Conservatives, while the main opposition Labour Party remained on course for victory in next week’s general election.
title: Reform UK Party Sees Record as Tories Hit Low, Poll of Polls Shows

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Biden Debate Debacle Puts the World on Trump Alert

description: Lawsuits over toxic products. Compensation for survivors of sexual abuse. Deals to shield executives of companies driven to bankruptcy.
title: Supreme Court’s Sackler Ruling Upends Bankruptcy Settlements

description: The US said it was “deeply concerned” by new probes Hungary launched into an investigative journalism outlet as well as a graft watchdog, calling them “anti-democratic measures” threatening civil society and media freedom.
title: US Slams Hungary for Targeting Media, Graft Watchdog With Probes

description: A Philippine senator is calling for the removal of a town’s mayor suspected of being a Chinese national, possibly violating a law that requires local citizenship for all elected officials.
title: Philippine Senator Seeks Ouster of Mayor Probed Over Citizenship

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally has bolstered its lead ahead of the first round of France’s snap legislative election on Sunday as its rivals have stalled in their effort to catch up.
title: Le Pen’s National Rally Solidifies Lead Two Days Ahead of Voting

description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim has been a fierce critic of Israel over its war against Hamas. Now he’s resisting pressure from his own critics to nix a multi-billion dollar Malaysian airports privatization deal involving BlackRock Inc. over its ties to Israel.
title: Hamas-Backing Anwar Defends BlackRock in Face of Israel Protests

description: French inflation slowed a little — reinforcing the European Central Bank’s decision to begin cutting record-high interest rates and offering an economic bright spot for President Emmanuel Macron two days before elections.
title: French Inflation Resumes Slowdown Two Days Before Elections

description: Britain’s economy bounced out of recession with the strongest growth in more than two years and faster than previously estimated, with services and consumer spending both driving the gains.
title: UK Economy Grew Faster Than Expected as Consumers Spent More

description: Namibia plans to set up a special purpose vehicle that descendants of victims of the 1904-1908 genocide will manage and control, Vice President Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah said.
title: Namibia to Set Up Firm for German Genocide Victims’ Descendants

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. In this special edition, Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green assesses the first Biden-Trump debate. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Democrats Hit Panic Button in Wake of Biden Debate Debacle

description: President Joe Biden’s debate performance is raising new questions about whether Democrats have any other options in November if the 81-year-old president is no longer willing or able to campaign.
title: Democrats Question Replacing Biden: Here’s How It Could Work

description: Russian Defense Minister Andrey Belousov instructed the army’s General Staff to take “rapid response measures” against US drones over the Black sea as their increased activity raises the likelihood of incidents in airspace.
title: Russia Vows to Take Measures Against US Drones Over Black Sea

description: Argentina’s Congress approved President Javier Milei’s signature pro-business reforms, marking an inflection point for the outsider to govern with a hostile political class he continues to rail against.
title: Milei Wins Approval for Bold Economic Reforms in Argentina

description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping called for the Global South to have a greater say in international affairs, stepping up his efforts to challenge the US-led world order.
title: Xi Calls for Global South to Play Bigger Role on World Stage

description: President Joe Biden bet that a debate with Republican Donald Trump would boost his moribund reelection campaign. His gamble failed.
title: Biden’s Disastrous Debate Accelerates Doubts Over Candidacy

description: US and French diplomats are racing to avert a far broader conflict.
title: Israel and Hezbollah Lurch Closer to War

description: President Joe Biden floundered during the presidential debate against former President Donald Trump, failing a key test to demonstrate to voters he’s up for a second term.
title: Biden Struggles as He Spars With Trump on Economy: Debate Takeaways

description: Donald Trump accused China of “killing” the US and alleged that Joe Biden was bringing the US closer to a global conflict during the first debate ahead of November’s presidential election.
title: China Is ‘Killing Us as a Country,’ Trump Tells Biden in Debate

description: Top diplomats and defense chiefs from Japan and the Philippines will hold talks early next month, seeking to bolster security ties as tensions with China linger.
title: Top Envoys, Defense Heads From Japan, Philippines to Hold Talks

description: Maryam, a 37-year-old fitness instructor in Tehran, used to put her disdain for Iranian politicians to one side for elections on the basis her vote could help to bring about change.
title: Iran’s Election Overshadowed by Economic and Regional Turmoil

description: Japan is getting a new currency czar just as the yen trades near its weakest levels in almost four decades, the nation’s finance minister said.
title: Japan Names New Currency Czar as Yen Continues Its Slide, Nikkei Reports

description: Bolivia’s president denied that he staged a dramatic coup against his own administration in an attempt to improve his popularity, rebutting a detained general who said he led the uprising on executive orders.
title: Bolivian Leader Denies He Staged Coup in Bid to Boost Popularity

description: President Joe Biden stumbled through early exchanges in Thursday’s presidential debate, a performance that risks exacerbating concerns about his age and intensifying Democratic worries about their candidate’s ability to defeat Republican Donald Trump in November’s election.
title: Biden Stumbles in Early Debate Exchanges as Trump Pounces
